data.enText: ground
ground
food/flour/coffee
to break or crush sth into very small pieces between two hard surfaces or using a special machine

data.chText: 将咖啡 / 谷粒磨成粉
data.enText: to grind coffee/corn
to produce sth such as flour by crushing

data.chText: 这面粉是用传统方法磨制而成。
data.enText: The flour is ground using traditional methods.
make sharp/smooth
to make sth sharp or smooth by rubbing it against a hard surface
a special stone for grinding knives
press into surface

data.chText: 用力挤压，用力擦（入表层）
data.enText: to press or rub sth into a surface

data.chText: 他把香烟按在烟灰缸里捻灭。
data.enText: He ground his cigarette into the ashtray.
The dirt on her hands was ground in.
rub together
to rub together, or to make hard objects rub together, often producing an unpleasant noise

data.chText: 机器零件摩擦发出刺耳的声音。
data.enText: Parts of the machine were grinding together noisily.
She grinds her teeth when she is asleep.

data.chText: 他把汽车排挡踩得嘎嘎作响。
data.enText: He ground the gears on the car.
machine
to turn the handle of a machine that grinds sth
to grind a pepper mill
bring sth to a grinding halt
to make sth gradually go slower until it stops completely
grind to a halt
come to a grinding halt
to go slower gradually and then stop completely

data.chText: 罢工期间生产渐渐陷入瘫痪。
data.enText: Production ground to a halt during the strike.
have an axe to grind
to have private reasons for being involved in sth or for arguing for a particular cause

data.chText: 她毫无私心，这样做只是出于对他们安全的担心。
data.enText: She had no axe to grind and was only acting out of concern for their safety.
grind sb↔down
to treat sb in a cruel unpleasant way over a long period of time, so that they become very unhappy
Don't let them grind you down.

data.chText: 人民年复一年地遭受着压迫。
data.enText: Years of oppression had ground the people down.
grind on
to continue for a long time, when this is unpleasant

data.chText: 这场争论拖拖拉拉持续了近两年。
data.enText: The argument ground on for almost two years.
grind sth↔out

data.chText: 大量生产（尤指粗制滥造）
data.enText: to produce sth in large quantities, often sth that is not good or interesting

data.chText: 她以一年五部的速度胡乱拼凑低劣的爱情小说。
data.enText: She grinds out romantic novels at the rate of five a year.
boring activity

data.chText: 令人疲劳（或厌倦）的工作；苦差事
data.enText: an activity that is tiring or boring and takes a lot of time

data.chText: 家庭生活中繁重的家务劳动
data.enText: the daily grind of family life

data.chText: 爬到那种行业的最高位置要经过漫长的艰苦奋斗。
data.enText: It's a long grind to the top of that particular profession.
of machines
the unpleasant noise made by machines
swot

means: 用力挤压，用力擦（入表层）

tr: the act of grinding to a powder or dust
the grade of particle fineness to which a substance is ground
an insignificant student who is ridiculed as being affected or boringly studious
reduce to small pieces or particles by pounding or abrading
example: grind the spices in a mortar

tr: make a grating or grinding sound by rubbing together
press or grind with a crushing noise

example: grind lenses for glasses and cameras
grind designs into the glass bowl

tr: dance by rotating the pelvis in an erotically suggestive way, often while in contact with one's partner such that the dancers' legs are interlaced

example: She was digging away at her math homework

value.def: If you grind a substance such as corn, you crush it between two hard surfaces or with a machine until it becomes a fine powder.

example.ex: Store the peppercorns in an airtight container and grind the pepper as you need it.
example.tran: 将胡椒粒储存在密封容器中，在需要的时候磨成粉。

example.ex: He makes his own paint, grinding up the pigment with a little oil.
example.tran: 他就着几滴油磨了些颜料，自己制油彩。

value.tran: 磨碎；碾碎； 将…磨成粉

value.def: If you grind something into a surface, you press and rub it hard into the surface using small circular or sideways movements.

example.ex: 'Well,' I said, grinding my cigarette nervously into the granite step.
example.tran: “好吧，”我边说边紧张不安地把香烟在花岗岩台阶上捻灭。

defx.def: If you grind your teeth, you rub your upper and lower teeth together as though you are chewing something.

example.ex: If you know you're grinding your teeth, particularly at night, see your dentist.
example.tran: 如果你知道自己在磨牙，尤其是在夜间，你应该去看看牙医。

value.def: If you grind something, you make it smooth or sharp by rubbing it against a hard surface.

example.ex: The tip can be ground to a much sharper edge to cut smoother and faster.
example.tran: 可以把尖端磨得更锋利些，这样切割起来更顺更快。

value.tran: 把…磨锋利；把…磨快；把…磨光

value.def: If a vehicle grinds somewhere, it moves there very slowly and noisily.

example.ex: Tanks had crossed the border at five fifteen and were grinding south.
example.tran: 坦克队于5点15分越过边境，正轰隆隆地缓慢向南开进。

value.def: The grind of a machine is the harsh, scraping noise that it makes, usually because it is old or is working too hard.

example.ex: The grind of heavy machines could get on their nerves.
example.tran: 重型机器发出的刺耳的摩擦声会让他们心烦意乱。

value.def: If you refer to routine tasks or activities as the grind, you mean they are boring and take up a lot of time and effort.

example.ex: The daily grind of government is done by Her Majesty's Civil Service...
example.tran: 枯燥的日常政务都由女王陛下的政府行政部门来处理。

example.ex: Life continues to be a terrible grind for the ordinary person.
example.tran: 生活对于平头百姓而言依然是理不清的琐事。

value.def: If a country's economy or something such as a process grinds to a halt, it gradually becomes slower or less active until it stops.

example.ex: The peace process has ground to a halt while Israel struggles to form a new government.
example.tran: 当以色列竭力组建新政府的时候，和平进程已经陷于停顿。

value.def: If a vehicle grinds to a halt, it stops slowly and noisily.

example.ex: The tanks ground to a halt after a hundred yards because the fuel had been siphoned out.
example.tran: 由于燃油被人抽走，这些坦克行驶了100码后又轰隆隆地缓缓停了下来。

xrse.def: to come to a grinding  halt
